node.title: Food, fuel and cash in short supply as Solomon Islands civil unrest leaves trail of destruction
node.alt: People stand amid debris in front of a burned-out building after days of unrest in Honiara, Solomon Islands.
node.description: Riots, arson attacks and looting over three straight days of civil unrest leave the capital of Honiara short on food and essential services. This is what the crisis looks like on the ground.
node.content:
["There is smoke in the air and rubble on ground after days of rioting and arson attacks\u00a0in\u00a0Solomon Islands capital of Honiara.", "Businesses, schools and\u00a0even the Prime Minister's residence were set alight and looted by protesters during three straight days of civil unrest.", "Now people are struggling to restock food supplies, and there are queues at ATMs and petrol stations as the extent of the crisis begins to\u00a0take its toll.", "Unrest broke out on Wednesday when a peaceful protest\u00a0calling on Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare to step down turned violent\u00a0and quickly spiralled out of control of the local police.", "Australian troops and Papua New Guinea security personnel arrived in Honiara on Friday to assist local authorities as violence continues.", "The capital is now also under a government-enforced\u00a0curfew between the hours of\u00a07.00pm and 6.00am, which\u00a0will continue indefinitely.", "", "
Smoke rises from burning buildings in the Chinatown district.\u00a0(@Zfm Radio via Reuters)
", "
Arson attacks strain food supplies\u00a0
", "The main source of the conflict stems from the\u00a0government's 2019 decision to switch diplomatic allegiance from Taiwan to China, which led to a deterioration in the relationship between the traditionally pro-Taiwan Malaita province and the central government.", "ABC Radio Australia reporter Evan Wasuka is in Honiara and said while some are still looting, the focus for the community has turned to trying to restock food supplies after the Prime Minister's snap 36-hour lockdown on Wednesday caught people off guard.", "But arson attacks on the city's Chinatown district, where looting continued on Friday afternoon, have\u00a0strained the city's\u00a0food supplies.", "\"Chinatown is where a lot of people go for food,\" Mr Wasuka said.", "\"It\u00a0has\u00a0all the shops, the Chinese shops, which store most of the groceries and things like that.\"", "", "
Up to 50 AFP officers and 40 ADF personnel have arrived\u00a0in Solomon Islands.
", "
Shop owners caught up in violence\u00a0
", "If they haven't been burnt down, or looted, businesses in the Chinatown district are closed, as are most others in the city centre.", "The Red Cross has been setting out on foot to help stranded shop owners who have been caught up in the violence.\u00a0", "They have also been helping students stuck at the local university campus.\u00a0", "\"They [the Red Cross] have been transporting workers, students, and shop owners from dangerous areas and getting them to safety,\"\u00a0Adrian Prouse from the\u00a0Australian Red Cross, who has been in contact with his colleagues in the Solomon Islands, said.", "He added that volunteers were working to get food and other essentials to people in need as rioting continues.", "", "
Protesters have been calling\u00a0for the resignation of Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare.(Georgina Kekea via Reuters)
", "\"There are some shops on the outskirts of the city in the western part, which you have to travel to so that's where people are going,\" Mr Wasuka said.\u00a0", "\"One of the big things is that public transport is very limited, and then for people who have vehicles, the petrol stations have been closed in the last two days, and a lot of people are now out of fuel.", "He said the Chinese diaspora in Honiara have kept a low profile since the riots started.\u00a0", "", "
Rioters targeted Prime Minister Sogavare's compound.
", "The Chinese Embassy in Honiara has sent out an alert to the community to stay vigilant, not leave their homes unless it is\u00a0necessary and to stay away from the demonstrations.\u00a0", "Business owners\u00a0in the capital were told to suspend all activities.\u00a0", "\"On November 24th ...\u00a0anti-government demonstrations took place, and some local Chinese shops were destroyed, smashed and burned,\" the warning said.", "The statement asked the Solomon Islands government to take \"all necessary measures to strengthen the protection of Chinese enterprises and personnel and safeguard the safety and legitimate rights and interests of Chinese enterprises and citizens\".", "
Local businesses destroyed
", "Surian Yee, the co-owner of a clothing company in Honiara said businesses\u00a0were powerless to stop looters.", "\"It's just very sad to see our own people destroying our own businesses.", "\"I just hope people come to realise that what they're ultimately doing is just destroying our own backyard.\"", "", "
A police station in\u00a0Honiara was also targeted by rioters.\u00a0
", "Honiara cafe owner Desmond Zheng said\u00a0he was relieved to hear support was coming from Australia.\u00a0", "\"The police in Solomon Islands lack experience with this kind of thing but it's good for the Australian police to give them support,\" he told the ABC.", "He added that\u00a0he had become \"numb\" to the ethnic tensions in the country.", "In 2006, following the election of then-prime minister\u00a0Snyder Rini, rioters looted and\u00a0burned Chinese-owned businesses, because of claims that the election had been rigged with the financial assistance of Chinese businesspeople.", "Riots again broke out after Mr Sogavare\u00a0was elected for the fourth time in 2019."]
